sentences.en: After two decades of sluggish growth, output has soared since 1978.
sentences.cn: 经过二十年停滞不前, 1978年以来产量突飞猛进.

sentences.en: Alex woke late, feeling tired and sluggish.
sentences.cn: 亚历克斯醒得很晚，感到很倦怠。

sentences.en: Below him flowed a wide and sluggish river.
sentences.cn: 下面是一条流得很慢的很宽的河.

sentences.en: Circulation is much more sluggish in the feet than in the hands.
sentences.cn: 脚部的循环比手部的循环缓慢得多。

sentences.en: Don't be so sluggish . Put yourself together.
sentences.cn: 不要这样懒散,振作起来.

sentences.en: Economic recovery has so far been sluggish.
sentences.cn: 经济复苏的速度目前仍然缓慢。

sentences.en: I thought it was sluggish in its course, and cool, quite cool.
sentences.cn: 我倒认为它流得迟缓了, 也变得冷了, 很冷了.

sentences.en: She made all European progress seem sluggish by comparison.
sentences.cn: 她使得欧洲的一切进步相比之下显得十分缓慢.

sentences.en: Statistics paint a sobering picture — unemployment, tight credit, lower home values, sluggish job growth.
sentences.cn: 统计数据描绘了一幅不容乐观的画面：失业率攀升，信贷从紧，家庭观念淡薄，就业机会增长缓慢。
经济的发展仍然非常缓慢。

sentences.en: The eutectoid reactions which can occur are extremely sluggish.
sentences.cn: 可能发生的共折反应是非常缓慢的.

sentences.en: The pulse of joy that beats in us at twenty becomes sluggish.
sentences.cn: 二十岁时在我们身上跳动着的欢乐的脉搏会迟缓下来.

sentences.en: the sluggish black waters of the canal
sentences.cn: 运河里缓慢流动的黑乎乎的河水

sentences.en: The westward flow of population would have been far more sluggish.
sentences.cn: 否则人口的向西迁移也将缓慢得多.

sentences.en: This humid heat makes you feel rather sluggish.
sentences.cn: 这种湿热的天气使人感到懒洋洋的.

sentences.en: This wide and sluggish river was the Coppermine.
sentences.cn: 这条流得很慢的宽广的河就是铜矿河.

sentences.en: When hast thou been so sluggish before now?
sentences.cn: 你什么时候像现在这样懒洋洋过?

words.tran_cn: 鼻涕虫；动作缓慢的人；金属小块

trans.tran_cn: 行动迟缓的，反应慢的，不机警的，懒散的，不活泼的，无精打采的
trans.tran_en: moving or reacting more slowly than normal
